description.narrative: 5.1 Increased capacity to improve water quality and functionality and to deliver and sustain access to safe water (especially in schools and health-care facilities), which contributes to Disaster Risk Reduction, Water, Water (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and their families have improved and equitable access to and use of safe and sustainable drinking water and sanitation services, and improved hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 5.1 Increased capacity to improve water quality and functionality and to deliver and sustain access to safe water (especially in schools and health-care facilities)

description.narrative: UNICEF was able to declare seven communities as ‘Water Safe Communities', a milestone in achieving SDG goal for WASH 6.1. 84 communities (16,234 people) have benefitted from one house one tap facilities. Further, 5649 children in 92 schools/TLCs in earthquake affected districts benefited from provision of improved water supply | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of local bodies (Municipalities) with water quality monitoring mechanism operationalized
